Inspection name - user assigned, whichever one of these is not null

    /**
     * @return HasOneThrough
     */
    public function dronePilot () {
        return $this->userAssignment()
                    ->where(['type' => UserAssignments::TYPE_DRONE]);
    }
    
    /**
     * @return HasOneThrough
     */
    public function fieldInspector () {
        return $this->userAssignment()
                    ->where(['type' => UserAssignments::TYPE_FIELD]);
    }

Job Statuses are not updating. The just stay as Unassigned unless we manually move them. The need to update and data is put in. If I assign a field inspector, it should move to assigned. If the FI puts in an appointment D/T, it should move to Appointment Scheduled etc…..

Clarification needed - where is the source of truth for statuses (isn’t it Xact)?

Should this be a separate status column?

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1595013564305,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-110","author":"garthpmurray","authorFullName":"Garth Murray","issueId":"OD-84","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

\App\Http\Controllers\PdfController holds the current start point for making a pdf to view, you can use this to test things.

\App\Components\PDFBuilder\PDFBuilder holds all the stuff for actually creating a PDF.

\App\Console\Commands\CreateAssignmentPdfs::handle contains a block of PDFs to be generated and saved, simply add the invoice one to that list and you'll be good.

\App\Components\PDFBuilder\CreatePDF::getPDF contains the actual code to generate the PDF

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1595517774120,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-111","author":"garthpmurray","authorFullName":"Garth Murray","issueId":"OD-84","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
  • CreatePDF::getPDF command to build with the correct header/footer depending on PDF
  • \App\Console\Commands\CreateAssignmentPdfs $documents[] = $this->getPdfStream($assignment, PDFBuilder::INVOICE); with the other pdf streams.
